contextId.information: Yahweh is going to pursue and attack Ephraim like a lion. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: So I will be like a lion to Ephraim

contextId.information: Yahweh will come to help his people just as surely as the sun rises each morning. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: His coming out is as sure as the dawn

contextId.information: Here the prophet Hosea is speaking to God. He may mean that when God gives the command for someone to die as punishment, it is like a bolt of lightning that strikes (see UDB). Or he may mean that God's commandments allow people to know the truth, just as light makes objects visible. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Your decrees are like the light that shines out

contextId.information: This means like a fire burns in an oven, these people have strong evil desires within them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: For with hearts like an oven

contextId.information: The intensity of their anger is spoken of as if it was a very hot fire. AT: "it gets very intense" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: it burns high like a flaming fire

contextId.information: That is, a bow that has no bowstring, or that has no tension. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: They are like a slack bow

contextId.information: Here "mourners' food" refers to what people would eat while they mourning because they were defiled and not acceptable to God. This means Yahweh will consider the people's sacrifices to be defiled and he will not accept them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Their sacrifices will be to them like mourners' food

contextId.information: The people of Ephraim, or the northern kingdom of Israel, will lose everything that makes other nations respect them. Their glory will quickly disappear, as a bird flies away. AT: "their glory will be like a bird that flies away from them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: their glory will fly away like a bird

contextId.information: "planted" refers to being in a safe place. AT: "The nation of Israel was once beautiful and pleasant like the city of Tyre, like a tree that someone plants in a meadow" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I have seen Ephraim, just like Tyre, planted in a meadow

contextId.information: The altars where the people worshiped will be thrown down and become piles of stones. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: their altars will be like heaps of stone in the furrows of the fields

contextId.information: These expressions state that Israel is temporary and will soon disappear if they continue to worship idols instead of following Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: So they will be like the morning clouds ... like the dew ... like the chaff ... like smoke out of a chimney

contextId.information: These are wild animals that attack and kill other animals. Yahweh continues to say that he will destroy his people for their sins. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: like a lion ... like a leopard ... as a bear ... as a lion ... as a wild beast

contextId.information: This passage continues the same image. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: His branches will spread out ... like the cedars in Lebanon

contextId.information: Just as Lebanon's wine was famous, so Israel will be famous. AT: "People everywhere will know about the nation of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: His fame will be like the wine of Lebanon

contextId.information: A cypress is a tree whose leaves stay green all year. This represents Yahweh and his blessings on Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: a cypress whose leaves are always green
